alert.note: Alert for Greene; Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 3:32PM CDT until May 31 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Greene County in southwestern Missouri... East Central Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 332 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in less than one hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chesapeake. This includes the following low water crossings... Turnback Creek at County Road 2100. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
